page.title: 06ROADS
page.content: The A55 is the busiest road in North Wales, passing in an East to West direction across the Southern quarter of the block, which is at present a single carriageway. On the Western side of the block there is a steep hill called "Rhuallt Hill", which has become a notorious "accident blackspot. However the finance has now become available for its re-routing and subsequent improvement to dual carriageway status which will eventually form part of the expressway which is intended to run from Chester to the Isle of Anglesey. All other roads in the block are minor and in some cases rarely used single track lanes.
